com.github.dittmarsteiner.cooper

Class Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dittmarsteiner.cooper.Config

  • public class Config
extends Object
    Config is a smart and fast wrapper of a Map<String, Object> and provides easy access to all (hierarchical) entries via paths like "path.to.property.name" in a safe way: if there is no value an empty Optional is returned to avoid NullPointerExceptions.
    You can store all kind of types as value, especially Maps and Lists as structure elements, and return them in a type-safe way.

    Config itself does not read configurations from sources. The Jackson ObjectMapper, for exapmle, can read and convert any type to a Map.

    Use the Config.Builder to customize your Map before building an unmodifiable Config.

    Version:
    1.1.1
    Author:
    Dittmar Steiner
    See Also:
    Config.Builder

      Since Config is unmodifiable this is a convenient way to prepare the underlying modifiable Map.

    • Method Detail

      • getPaths

        public Set<String> getPaths()
        Just to inspect what’s available.
        Returns:
        all accessible paths

      • get

        public <T> Optional<T> get(String propertyPath)
        Access any available property by path. 
         Config config = new Config(map);
 
 // safe: is empty if not found
 Optional<String> name = config.get("name");
 
 // safe: uses the default orElse if not found
 String proxyName = config.get("proxy.name").orElse("Dale");
 
 // but you better know the type
 int proxyPort = config.<Integer>get("proxy.port").orElse(9999);
 
 // but this is your responsibility – this will throw a
 // ClassCastException
 int number = config.<Integer>get("name").orElse(42).intValue();
        Hint: config.get("") (an empty String) returns the internal unmodifiable Map.
        Parameters:
        propertyPath - like "path.to.property.name"
        Returns:
        an Optional of the requested type or Optional.empty() if not found
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if propertyPath is null
